title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 October 2013 - XWiki
content:
<UCC> has quit  
06:08 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
06:22 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
06:33 <UCC> has quit  
08:00 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <npst> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <npst> good morning :)  
09:16 <npst> When authenticating users over Kerberos, xwiki seems to expect a valid users even for images and such. Thus spamming the AD with authentication requests  
09:16 <npst> this (in my opinion) leads to slow responses  
09:17 <npst> is there a way to tell xwiki only to check for a valid user for non-static files, aka pages instead oof png, css ...  
09:28 <npst> (was that comprehensible? :D)  
09:31 <tmortagne> npst: what you could do is actually tell Apache to bypass XWiki for these  
09:32 <tmortagne> Apache or whatever else you have in front of your application server  
09:35 <tmortagne> wha authenticator are you using by the way ?  
09:35 <tmortagne> what  
09:35 <tmortagne> since there is no kerberos+LDAP auth in XWiki by default  
09:39 <tmortagne> since the other solution is to improve the SSO auth your are using to store in the session the current user to not check the LDAP server all the time  
09:39 <npst> i'm using AppServerTrustedKerberosAuthServiceImpl, but it seems to work with AppServerTrustedAuthServiceImpl as well  
09:39 <tmortagne> those don't access any LDAP server  
09:40 <npst> if i'm using the apache to bypass kerberos for those files, xwiki tends to get stuck in a loop of 200 and 401 return values (tries to log in the user for that file)  
09:40 <tmortagne> they just get the request remote user and create the XWiki user when it does not exist  
09:40 <tmortagne> so I don't really understand why you talk about LDAP server access  
09:41 <tmortagne> they don't do the actuall auth in other words, it's whatever you put in front of XWiki that take care of it and indicate the user to XWiki  
09:41 <npst> indeed  
09:42 <npst> but my wiki should only be accessible to those authed by kerberos, so i deactivated guest access  
09:44 <npst> I actually don't know where exactly the problem is, all I see in the apache logs are a lot of forbidden or authorization required requests by anonymous, followed by the exact same request with user credentials  
09:46 <npst> since several of those requests are above the 500 ms mark (which indicates a socket timeout, say the internet), I'm trying to think of a way to reduce the amount of those requests  
09:47 <npst> And i thought allowing xwiki to present images and css files to non-valid users would be a good way  
09:52 <tmortagne> as I said you can always configure apache to bypass XWiki for /resources/\* urls but seems to me you have an issue with your kerberos authenticator  
09:52 <tmortagne> either that or the browser  
09:52 <tmortagne> but I don't know kerberos very well  
09:57 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <npst> well, bypassing xwiki sounds interesting. would a new <Directory ...> entry be the way to go?  
09:59 <npst> (i'm new to all of this, not only kerberos :D)  
10:00 <tmortagne> not an Apache expert either, let me check the doc, I just know it's possible to tell Apache that for a kind of URL it should go somewhere else  
10:02 <tmortagne> sounds more like <Location>  
10:02 <tmortagne> http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/fr/mod/core.html#location  
10:02 <evalica> has quit  
10:04 <npst> thanks, i'll look into that  
10:05 <npst> apart from that, i assumed that kerberos was the way to go for SSO, so i didn't dig into xwikis ldap features.  
10:05 <npst> were you hinting on using xwiki to access the windows AD directly?  
10:05 <tmortagne> those are two different things  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:05 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <npst> i don't understand  
10:06 <tmortagne> LDAP still require a login/password  
10:06 <tmortagne> while main job of kerberos is to automatically authenticate the user without him typing anything  
10:07 <tmortagne> and then kerberos itself rely on a LDAP database (Active Directory)  
10:07 <npst> i see  
10:08 <npst> so if i'd give my SSO/Kerberos stuff, ldap is the way to go  
10:08 <tmortagne> another SSO that seems to be used a lot on Windows is NTLM (but maybe it's another name for kerberos)  
10:09 <tmortagne> based on Active Directory too so it's pretty much the same idea  
10:09 <npst> yeah, I had NTLM before, but it's deprecated in Version 1 on current systems  
10:09 <tmortagne> the other solution being to not setup SSO and ask user for login/passord with XWiki LDAP authenticator  
10:10 <npst> that's a good fallback plan to have, thank you again  
10:10 <tmortagne> now I seen perfectly working setup of kerberos so I guess it's just about configuration but I can't help you much with that  
10:12 <npst> And I've seen people complain about low speed with kerberos, but no solution :D  
10:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:32 <vmassol> has quit  
10:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <vmassol> guys, I'm going to work on uprgading xwiki.org to 5.2  
11:22 <vmassol> anyone against?  
11:23 <vmassol> if not, I'll start by putting xwiki.org in readonly mode while working on the upgrade  
11:23 <vmassol> ok?  
11:25 <vmassol> mflorea: does this UIX support multiple implementors? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionPoint/AfterHeaderUIX  
11:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: don't prefer to test on myxwiki.org before ?  
11:29 <vmassol> yes ideally it would be better but more work since my end goal was to upgrade xwiki.org for active installs ;)  
11:29 <vmassol> you think there's a risk?  
11:30 <vmassol> again I'm doing this on a separate VM  
11:30 <npst> nah, you'll be fine  
11:30 <npst> godspeed, brother  
11:30 <vmassol> :)  
11:30 <vmassol> so at worse the upgrade will fail and I'll just remove readonly  
11:31 <vmassol> well the other risk is that for ex it crashes every day after I instlal it  
11:32 <vmassol> so I'll put back the existing version and since there's been no DB changes (except for activeinstalls which adds a new table) it should be fine I think  
11:32 <vmassol> wdyt?  
11:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <mflorea> vmassol: wdym by "implementors"? it works like any other extension point. We look for all extensions that provide content for that particular point and display it. You can have ofc multiple menus or other things displayed after header. It wouldn't have much sense to use an extension point if it was limited to the menu application only.  
11:37 <vmassol> mflorea: just tested and it works  
11:38 <mflorea> great  
11:39 <vmassol> guys can you give me an ok for the upgrade or tell me it's too risky and i won't do it  
11:39 <vmassol> :)  
11:39 <vmassol> I need to decide  
11:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: was an attempt to find someone to upgrade myxwiki.org ;)  
11:40 <vmassol> hehe  
11:40 <vmassol> nice try  
11:40 <vmassol> I may do it later on if I find the energy  
11:40 <vmassol> so does it mean you're ok for upgrading xwiki.org to 5.2?  
11:40 <mflorea> vmassol: +1 for the upgrade  
11:41 <tmortagne> anyway green light for me for xwiki.org upgrade,  
11:41 <vmassol> ok thanks, starting  
15:59 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
16:09 <UCC> has quit  
16:20 <ldubost> has quit  
16:22 <vmassol> wait  
16:29 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <vmassol> mflorea: we need to configure SOLR on xwiki.org  
16:34 <vmassol> so that it only searches in some wikis (as we used to do for lucene)  
16:34 <vmassol> how do I do that?  
16:35 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't think that's possible  
16:35 <vmassol> ouch  
16:36 <vmassol> so we'll need to add this feature  
16:36 <mflorea> you select the wiki from the advanced search, but there is no configuration  
16:36 <vmassol> there wasn't a ui either for mucene  
16:36 <vmassol> lucene  
16:36 <vmassol> but we could change the page code to provide a list of wikis  
16:36 <vmassol> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Migrations#HOnwww.xwiki.org  
16:37 <vmassol> #set($allwikinamelist = ["xwiki", "platform", "enterprise", "manager", "extensions", "dev", "contrib", "commons", "rendering"])  
16:37 <sburjan> has quit  
16:38 <vmassol> I'll create a jira  
16:38 <vmassol> right now it's not nice becuase users see and search in wikis such as "newwiki", "xclams," etc  
16:40 <vmassol> mf  
16:40 <vmassol> mflorea: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9559  
16:40 <mflorea> vmassol: that list is used just for UI, just to override the lists of wiki displayed in the select  
16:41 <mflorea> it's not a feature  
16:41 <mflorea> it was simply customized for xwiki.org  
16:41 <vmassol> yep that's all I need for xwiki.org  
16:41 <vmassol> no  
16:41 <vmassol> it was in the code  
16:41 <vmassol> dipslay code  
16:41 <vmassol> and I used it for xwiki.org  
16:41 <mflorea> so just edit Main.SolrSearch  
16:41 <vmassol> ah cool  
16:41 <vmassol> that's all I was asking for :)  
16:42 <vmassol> you have a lock  
16:42 <vmassol> you're doing it?  
16:42 <mflorea> I'm just looking over the code  
16:42 <mflorea> force me  
16:42 <mflorea> look for wikiSelector macro  
16:42 <mflorea> and instead of #set ($wikiNames = $xwiki.wikiNames)  
16:42 <tmortagne> ideally all that will be based on hidden wikis gdelhumeau is introducing  
16:42 <vmassol> not sure tmortagne  
16:42 <mflorea> you put #set ($wikiNames = ['wiki1', 'wiki2', etc.])  
16:43 <vmassol> because xclams may not be hidden  
16:43 <vmassol> it's jsut that we don't want to see it from xwiki.org  
16:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: if we don't want to find it it should  
16:43 <vmassol> but maybe from some other locations we'll want to see it  
16:43 <mflorea> actually, search for "$xwiki.wikiNames"  
16:43 <mflorea> there are 2 occurances  
16:44 <mflorea> so it's best to define a global variable and use it in these two places  
16:44 <vmassol> doesn't work mflorea  
16:44 <vmassol> the facets still show all wikis  
16:44 <vmassol> and the results too  
16:44 <vmassol> could you check what I've done?  
16:44 <vmassol> maybe I made a mistake  
16:45 <mflorea> you did the right thing  
16:45 <mflorea> what is the problem exactly?  
16:45 <vmassol> only the listed wikis should be displayed  
16:45 <vmassol> ["xwiki", "platform", "enterprise", "manager", "extensions", "dev", "contrib", "commons", "rendering"]  
16:46 <mflorea> and?  
16:46 <mflorea> that's what the select displays  
16:46 <vmassol> try this: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=blog  
16:47 <vmassol> first link shows a result from xclams and the facets shows all wikis  
16:47 <vmassol> which is NOT what we want  
16:47 <vmassol> and NOT what we had with lucene  
16:47 <mflorea> your change was just for the UI of the filter  
16:47 <mflorea> (17:40:59) mflorea: vmassol: that list is used just for UI, just to override the lists of wiki displayed in the select  
16:47 <vmassol> you're the expert just tell me what to change  
16:47 <vmassol> :)  
16:47 <vmassol> I'm just following your instructions  
16:48 <vmassol> I just want to change UI  
16:48 <vmassol> I don't care that internally it searches in all wikis ATM  
16:48 <vmassol> but we must not show results from some wikis  
16:48 <vmassol> like playground, curriki, xclams, newwiki, etc  
16:48 <mflorea> my instructions were just to restrict what wikis are listed in the select from the advanced filter  
16:49 <mflorea> and it works  
16:49 <vmassol> ok that's not enough  
16:49 <vmassol> what else can we do?  
16:49 <mflorea> well, I don't see where lucene uses that list to restrict the search result  
16:49 <mflorea> afaics it uses the list to restrict the select from the filter  
16:57 <msmeria> has quit  
17:02 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
17:02 <mflorea> vmassol: can you check now?  
17:02 <mflorea> you can also check the diff  
17:02 <vmassol> yep looking  
17:03 <vmassol> the good news is that with EM we shouldn't need to do the merge manually next time  
17:03 <vmassol> very cool  
17:03 <vmassol> seems to work fine  
17:03 <vmassol> thanks mflorea!  
17:03 <mflorea> np  
17:03 <vmassol> should I leave the issue open? could be interesintg, wdyT?  
17:04 <mflorea> you mean XWIKI-9559? I don't know.  
17:04 <mflorea> the question is if we want/need it in the platform  
17:06 <vmassol> seems useful to me, now do we need this in addition to hidden wikis, i don't know  
17:06 <vmassol> well  
17:06 <mflorea> I'm not sure the right solution is to have a configurable list of searchable wikis. Could be a config in the (sub)wiki  
17:06 <vmassol> if we have the need for xwiki.org then we need it  
17:07 <vmassol> it means the use case exists and it' sbetter to offer it for the user  
17:07 <vmassol> ideally we wouldn't have to change any code on xwiki.org  
17:07 <vmassol> for example XWikiUserProfileSheet shouldn't be touched either  
17:08 <vmassol> it's also a list of wikis for which to dsplay the user AS  
17:08 <tmortagne> IMO the way to deal with XWIKI-9559 is hidden wikis  
17:08 <mflorea> sure, but what I'm saying is maybe the config should be moved to the subwiki, saying "I wasn't to be viewable/searchable from the main wiki"  
17:09 <tmortagne> yep hidden wiki  
17:09 <mflorea> s/wasn't/want  
17:10 <vmassol> tmortagne: imagine that we have 3 subwiikis: xclams, curriki, education  
17:10 <vmassol> and that from the education wiki we want to search in xclasm and curriki  
17:10 <vmassol> now from xwiki.org we don't want to search in these wikis  
17:10 <tmortagne> vmassol: you are describing a subfarm, maybe they should have their own...  
17:10 <vmassol> if you mark them hidden then they're hidden for all use cases  
17:11 <vmassol> sure but having a configurable list of wikis at least allows for this use case  
17:11 <vmassol> so it's one more feature  
17:11 <vmassol> if it can save users a farm it's all the best  
17:11 <mflorea> vmassol: with the current ui you cannot search in other wikis from a subwiki, only from the main wiki  
17:11 <vmassol> having lots of farm is not the simplest  
17:12 <mflorea> so the "from the education wiki we want to search in xclasm and curriki" is not a supported use case  
17:12 <tmortagne> right  
17:12 <mflorea> a subwiki is able to search only in its documents  
17:14 <mflorea> ofc, at the API level you can specify in which wikis to search, so there's no limitation there, except maybe from some rights (programming rights?)  
17:14 <tmortagne> mflorea: I think solr query API require PR right now anyway  
17:15 <npst> has quit  
17:24 <ldubost> has quit  
17:25 <ldubost> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <mflorea> has quit  
17:30 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:31 <msmeria> vmassol: The links for the "Latest product version tested" don't show up here: http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/WebHome I think this is related to your 5.2 upgrade  
17:31 <msmeria> it was working fine before afair  
17:32 <vmassol> msmeria: what links?  
17:32 <vmassol> ah yes  
17:32 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
17:32 <vmassol> hmm  
17:32 <vmassol> interesting  
17:33 <msmeria> instead of [QA.XWiki 5\.2 M2] there should be a link to http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/QA/XWiki+5.2+M2  
17:33 <evalica> has quit  
17:34 <vmassol> is it normal that it says it's HTM?  
17:34 <vmassol> HTML  
17:36 <msmeria> I really don't know. It's Sorin's work there..  
17:37 <vmassol> well it looks wrong  
17:37 <vmassol> first it's not HTML  
17:37 <vmassol> and second it's not a valid markup for a link  
17:37 <vmassol> it looks like XWiki syntax 1.0  
17:38 <vmassol> check http://test.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/get/QA/LiveTableResults?outputSyntax=plain&transprefix=qaapp.WebHome.LiveTable.&classname=&collist=doc.name,doc.space,product,browsers,databases,automated&offset=1&limit=15&reqNo=1&sort=doc.name&dir=asc  
17:38 <vmassol> the JSON portion is:  
17:38 <vmassol> "product":"[QA.XWiki 5\\.2 M2]"  
17:39 <vmassol> a link would be [[…]]  
17:39 <vmassol> I don't understand how that was working before  
17:42 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
17:58 <vmassol> hmm I thoguht playgorund was excluded from the irc bot  
17:58 <vmassol> and playground not playgroundtemplate  
17:58 <vmassol> I need toe xclude it too

17:59 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
18:00 <vmassol> hmmm
